awd_abstract_narration: The Department of Statistics at the University of                          Pennsylvania will purchase three Hewlett Packard 9000/735                       workstations which will be dedicated to the support of research                 in the mathematical sciences.  Each will be configured with the                 necessary hardware and software to provide a distributed cost-                  effective floating-point computing system.  This system will be                 used for the following four research projects:  (1) Hidden Markov               Models, Symbolic Computation and Stochastic Calculus, and                       Combinatorial Optimization; (2) Surveys, Observational Studies,                 and Matching; (3) Computational Problems in Statistical Finance;                and (4) Time Series Analysis.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: TRUSTEES OF THE UNIVERSITY OF PENNSYLVANIA, THE
